suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
the role of smell in human memory formation

formats.name: micro_flash
formats.instruction: Describe an insight or event in just one vivid sentence, maximum impact. Avoid any context or explanation.

formats.name: story_generator
formats.instruction: Invent a hypothetical scenario: start with 'Imagine if...' and narrate a mini-story about what happens next. Make the tale quirky and surprising. Limit to 75-120 words.

formats.name: dialogue_duel
formats.instruction: Write a brief conversational back-and-forth: two characters debating, questioning, or riffing on a topic. Maximum 6 lines. Each line a sentence or less.

formats.name: mind_map
formats.instruction: Unspool your thoughts as a branching mind map. Start with one main idea, then list related tangents, questions, or associations. Minimum three branches, 150-250 words.

formats.name: reverse_explainer
formats.instruction: Describe a topic in detail, but deliberately leave out the key concept. Challenge readers to guess what it is. 100-200 words.

formats.name: metaphor_machine
formats.instruction: Compare your topic to something wildly unrelated—like it’s a machine, a creature, or a tiny universe. Use at least two vivid metaphors and explain each. 120-180 words.

formats.name: time_lapse
formats.instruction: Describe how your topic changes over time, decade by decade, as if narrating a time-lapse. Present each era in one sentence. Minimum 5 eras. 150-300 words.

formats.name: rule_breaker
formats.instruction: Describe a topic, then state the 'unwritten rules' people follow. Next, show how breaking those rules changes everything. 200-350 words.

formats.name: secret_recipe
formats.instruction: Reveal a 'recipe' for approaching the topic, but use playful, cryptic steps. Each step should mix advice with whimsy. 5-7 steps, 110-160 words.

title_styles: Write a title that invites mystery: 'What nobody notices about X—until it’s too late'
Write a playful, pun-based title: 'X marks the spot: digging into the hidden layers of Y'
Write a poetic, evocative title: 'The shadow behind X and the light it casts'
Write a question-based title: 'Have you ever wondered why X keeps happening?'
Write a title that promises transformation: 'How X flips the script for Y'
structure_variants: Write as a back-and-forth dialogue, two voices alternating lines.
Present your ideas as a visual mind map—with branches and connections.
Use a recipe format: break your advice or story into 'ingredients' and 'steps'.
Describe the evolution chronologically, era by era, with time markers.
Start with an enigma or puzzle, then incrementally reveal clues.
topic_angles: Urban legends and myths in technology
The secret life cycle of forgotten objects
Strange emotional reactions to common situations
How small missteps lead to big changes
